document_chunks.text:
ANGELS OF DEATH - ELIMINATOR SNIPER
The ELIMINATOR SNIPER ignores Saturate when targeted, benefits from enhanced Stealthy CHAPTER TACTIC cover saves, and can spend 1AP to prevent enemy obscured status when shooting until its next activation.
## ANGELS OF DEATH - ELIMINATOR SNIPER
**Stats:**
- APL: 3
- Move: 7"
- Save: 3+
- Wounds: 12

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Ranged | Bolt pistol | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | Range 8" |
| Ranged | Bolt sniper rifle (executioner) | 4 | 2+ | 3/4 | Heavy (Dash only), Saturate, Seek Light, Silent |
| Ranged | Bolt sniper rifle (hyperfrag) | 4 | 2+ | 2/4 | Blast 1", Heavy (Dash only), Silent |
| Ranged | Bolt sniper rifle (mortis) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | Devastating 3, Heavy (Dash only), Piercing 1, Silent |
| Melee | Fists | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | - |

**Keywords:** ANGEL OF DEATH, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, ELIMINATOR, SNIPER

### ELIMINATOR SNIPER - Camo Cloak
Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, ignore the **Saturate** weapon rule. This operative has the **Stealthy CHAPTER TACTIC**. If you selected that **CHAPTER TACTIC**, you can do both of its options (i.e. retain two cover saves - one normal and one critical success).

### ELIMINATOR SNIPER - Optics [1AP]
Until the start of this operative's next activation, whenever it's shooting, enemy operatives cannot be **obscured**. This operative cannot perform this action while within **control range** of an enemy operative.

metadata.summary: The ELIMINATOR SNIPER ignores Saturate when targeted, benefits from enhanced Stealthy CHAPTER TACTIC cover saves, and can spend 1AP to prevent enemy obscured status when shooting until its next activation.

document_chunks.text:
[FAQ] ***Question***: Can you **NETWORK COUNTERACT** if your opponent doesn't have any ready operatives remaining to activate?
NETWORK COUNTERACT can be performed even if the opponent has no ready operatives remaining to activate.
## [FAQ] ***Question***: Can you **NETWORK COUNTERACT** if your opponent doesn't have any ready operatives remaining to activate?
***Answer***: Yes.
document_chunks.header: [FAQ] ***Question***: Can you **NETWORK COUNTERACT** if your opponent doesn't have any ready operatives remaining to activate?

metadata.summary: NETWORK COUNTERACT can be performed even if the opponent has no ready operatives remaining to activate.
metadata.header: [FAQ] ***Question***: Can you **NETWORK COUNTERACT** if your opponent doesn't have any ready operatives remaining to activate?

document_chunks.text:
COUNTERACT
If all your operatives are expended but your opponent has ready operatives, you may counteract once per operative per turning point by performing a free 1AP action with movement limited to 2".
## COUNTERACT

When you would activate a **ready** friendly operative, if all your operatives are **expended** but your opponent still has **ready** operatives, you can select an **expended** friendly operative with an **Engage** order to perform a 1AP action (excluding **Guard**) for free. Each operative can only **counteract** once per turning point. That operative cannot move more than 2", or must be set up wholly within 2" if it's removed and set up again, while counteracting (this is not a change to its Move stat, and takes precedence over all other rules). Counteracting is optional, so you can choose not to. In either case, activation alternates back to your opponent afterwards.

> **Designer's Commentary:** Counteracting is not an activation. This is an important distinction because it means rules like action restrictions (an operative cannot perform the same action more than once during its activation) do not apply.

metadata.summary: If all your operatives are expended but your opponent has ready operatives, you may counteract once per operative per turning point by performing a free 1AP action with movement limited to 2".

document_chunks.text:
Silent
Silent allows shooting with the weapon while the operative has a Conceal order.
## Silent
An operative can perform the Shoot action with this weapon while it has a **Conceal** order.

metadata.summary: Silent allows shooting with the weapon while the operative has a Conceal order.

document_chunks.text:
ORDERS
Engage orders allow full actions and counteracting, while Conceal orders prevent shooting, charging, and counteracting but grant invalid target status when in cover; orders can be changed upon activation.
## ORDERS

### Engage
**Engage:** The operative can perform actions as normal and can counteract.

### Conceal
**Conceal:** The operative cannot perform Shoot and Charge actions, and it cannot counteract. However, it's not a valid target while it's in cover.

Operatives are given a Conceal order when they are set up before the battle. You can change an operative's order whenever it's activated.

Order tokens have two sides. The lighter side shows an operative is ready (it can be activated in the Firefight phase) and the darker side shows an operative is expended (it has been activated in the Firefight phase).

metadata.summary: Engage orders allow full actions and counteracting, while Conceal orders prevent shooting, charging, and counteracting but grant invalid target status when in cover; orders can be changed upon activation.

document_chunks.text:
DIMENSIONAL AMBUSH - Firefight Ploy
During a friendly HIEROTEK CIRCLE DEATHMARK operative's activation with Conceal order, it can perform Guard regardless of killzone, but must change to Engage when performing a free Shoot or Fight action during the interruption.
## DIMENSIONAL AMBUSH - Firefight Ploy
Use this firefight ploy during a friendly **HIEROTEK CIRCLE DEATHMARK** operative's activation, if it has a **Conceal** order. During that activation, that operative can perform the **Guard** action regardless of the killzone and while it has a **Conceal** order, but when you perform the free **Shoot** or **Fight** action during the interruption, you must change its order to **Engage**.

metadata.summary: During a friendly HIEROTEK CIRCLE DEATHMARK operative's activation with Conceal order, it can perform Guard regardless of killzone, but must change to Engage when performing a free Shoot or Fight action during the interruption.

document_chunks.text:
DEATH KORPS - SNIPER
The Sniper's Long-las in Concealed Position is Devastating, Heavy, Silent, and usable only on its first Shoot action each battle.
## DEATH KORPS - SNIPER
**Stats:**
- APL: 2
- Move: 6"
- Save: 5+
- Wounds: 7

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|------|------|-----|-----|-----|--------------|
| ranged | Long-las (concealed) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | Devastating 3, Heavy, Silent, Concealed Position* |
| ranged | Long-las (mobile) | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | - |
| ranged | Long-las (stationary) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | Devastating 3, Heavy |
| melee | Bayonet | 3 | 4+ | 2/3 | - |

**Keywords:** DEATH KORPS, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, SNIPER

### SNIPER - *Concealed Position
*DEATH KORPS - SNIPER*
This operative can only use this weapon the first time it's performing the **Shoot** action during the battle.

metadata.summary: The Sniper's Long-las in Concealed Position is Devastating, Heavy, Silent, and usable only on its first Shoot action each battle.

document_chunks.text:
HARDWIRED TARGET LOCKS - Faction Equipment
Allows counteracting with a friendly XV26 Stealth Battlesuit with Conceal order more than 3" from enemies by changing its order to Engage and restricting actions to Shoot during that counteraction.
## HARDWIRED TARGET LOCKS - Faction Equipment
Whenever you would **counteract**, you can do so with one friendly **XV26 STEALTH BATTLESUIT** operative that has a **Conceal** order and is more than 3" from enemy operatives, but before it **counteracts**, you must change its order to **Engage** and it cannot perform any actions other than **Shoot** during that **counteraction**.

metadata.summary: Allows counteracting with a friendly XV26 Stealth Battlesuit with Conceal order more than 3" from enemies by changing its order to Engage and restricting actions to Shoot during that counteraction.

The BROOD BROTHER SNIPER's concealed sniper rifle can only be used once per battle on its first Shoot action and features Devastating, Heavy, and Silent weapon rules.
## BROOD BROTHERS - BROOD BROTHER SNIPER
**Stats:**
- APL: 2
- Move: 6"
- Save: 5+
- Wounds: 7

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|--- |--- |--- |--- |--- |--- |
| Ranged | Sniper rifle (concealed) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | Devastating 3, Heavy, Silent, Concealed Position |
| Ranged | Sniper rifle (mobile) | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | - |
| Ranged | Sniper rifle (stationary) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | Devastating 3, Heavy |
| Melee | Fists | 3 | 4+ | 2/3 | - |

**Keywords:** BROOD BROTHER, TYRANID, GENESTEALER CULT, BROODGUARD, SNIPER

### BROOD BROTHER SNIPER - Concealed Position
This operative can only use this weapon the first time it's performing the **Shoot** action during the battle.

metadata.summary: The BROOD BROTHER SNIPER's concealed sniper rifle can only be used once per battle on its first Shoot action and features Devastating, Heavy, and Silent weapon rules.

document_chunks.text:
SHOOT AND HIDE - Firefight Ploy
The SHOOT AND HIDE firefight ploy allows a friendly RATLING operative with an Engage order to change its order to Conceal after shooting with a rifle if more than 3" from enemies or not visible to all enemies.
## SHOOT AND HIDE - Firefight Ploy
Use this firefight ploy after a friendly **RATLING** operative that has an **Engage** order performs the **Shoot** action with a rifle. If it's more than 3" from enemy operatives, or not **visible** to every enemy operative, you can change its order to **Conceal**.

metadata.summary: The SHOOT AND HIDE firefight ploy allows a friendly RATLING operative with an Engage order to change its order to Conceal after shooting with a rifle if more than 3" from enemies or not visible to all enemies.

document_chunks.text:
ELUCIDIAN STARSTRIDERS - VOIDSMAN
VOIDSMAN can counteract once per turning point using a PRIVATEER SUPPORT ASSET weapon while having a Conceal order, but can only perform Shoot actions during that counteraction.
## ELUCIDIAN STARSTRIDERS - VOIDSMAN
**Stats:**
- APL: 2
- Move: 6"
- Save: 5+
- Wounds: 7

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| ranged | Lasgun | 4 | 4+ | 2/3 | |
| ranged | Rotor cannon (focused) | 5 | 4+ | 4/5 | **Heavy** (Dash only), **Rending** |
| ranged | Rotor cannon (sweeping) | 4 | 4+ | 4/5 | **Heavy** (Dash only), **Rending**, **Torrent 1"** |
| melee | Gun butt | 3 | 4+ | 2/3 | |

**Keywords:** ELUCIDIAN STARSTRIDER, IMPERIUM, NAVIS, VOIDSMAN

### VOIDSMAN - Crewmen
Once per turning point, whenever you would **counteract**, if you haven't used a **PRIVATEER SUPPORT ASSET** during this turning point, you can use this rule. If you do, you can **counteract** with one friendly **ELUCIDIAN STARSTRIDER VOIDSMAN** operative that has a **Conceal** order, but during that counteraction you cannot perform any actions other than **Shoot**, and you must use a **PRIVATEER SUPPORT ASSET** to do so.

metadata.summary: VOIDSMAN can counteract once per turning point using a PRIVATEER SUPPORT ASSET weapon while having a Conceal order, but can only perform Shoot actions during that counteraction.

document_chunks.text:
HUNTING ASTARTES - Faction Rule
Wolf Scout operatives can perform two Shoot or two Fight actions per activation with restrictions on plasma weapons and psychic ranged weapons, and can counteract regardless of order with added flexibility within your Storm.
## HUNTING ASTARTES - Faction Rule
During each friendly **WOLF SCOUT** operative's activation, it can perform either two **Shoot** actions or two **Fight** actions. If it's two **Shoot** actions:
- 1 additional AP must be spent for the second action if both actions are using a plasma gun or plasma pistol.
- You cannot select two **PSYCHIC** ranged weapons.

Each friendly **WOLF SCOUT** operative can **counteract** regardless of its order. Whenever it does so within your STORM, you can change its order first, or change its order instead of performing an action (for the latter, still treat it as having counteracted this turning point).

metadata.summary: Wolf Scout operatives can perform two Shoot or two Fight actions per activation with restrictions on plasma weapons and psychic ranged weapons, and can counteract regardless of order with added flexibility within your Storm.

document_chunks.text:
ANGELS OF DEATH - ASTARTES - Faction Rule
Each ANGEL OF DEATH operative can perform two Shoot or two Fight actions per activation with at least one bolt weapon used when shooting, and can counteract regardless of order.
## ANGELS OF DEATH - ASTARTES - Faction Rule
During each friendly **ANGEL OF DEATH** operative's activation, it can perform either two **Shoot** actions or two **Fight** actions. If it's two **Shoot** actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them, and if it's a bolt sniper rifle or heavy bolter, 1 additional AP must be spent for the second action if both actions are using that weapon.

Each friendly **ANGEL OF DEATH** operative can **counteract** regardless of its order.
document_chunks.header: ANGELS OF DEATH - ASTARTES - Faction Rule

metadata.summary: Each ANGEL OF DEATH operative can perform two Shoot or two Fight actions per activation with at least one bolt weapon used when shooting, and can counteract regardless of order.
metadata.header: ANGELS OF DEATH - ASTARTES - Faction Rule

document_chunks.text:
[FAQ] *Question*: If an operative can perform the **Shoot action** while within control range of an enemy operative (e.g. **CORSAIR VOIDSCARRED STARSTORM DUELLIST Quick on the Trigger**), can it perform the Shoot action on the other side of a door that's ignored when determining visibility for the purposes of control range, even though the target isn't visible to it?
An operative shooting while within control range cannot shoot targets behind doors ignored for visibility if the target is not visible.
## [FAQ] *Question*: If an operative can perform the **Shoot action** while within control range of an enemy operative (e.g. **CORSAIR VOIDSCARRED STARSTORM DUELLIST Quick on the Trigger**), can it perform the Shoot action on the other side of a door that's ignored when determining visibility for the purposes of control range, even though the target isn't visible to it?
*Answer*: No.
document_chunks.header: [FAQ] *Question*: If an operative can perform the **Shoot action** while within control range of an enemy operative (e.g. **CORSAIR VOIDSCARRED STARSTORM DUELLIST Quick on the Trigger**), can it perform the Shoot action on the other side of a door that's ignored when determining visibility for the purposes of control range, even though the target isn't visible to it?

metadata.header: [FAQ] *Question*: If an operative can perform the **Shoot action** while within control range of an enemy operative (e.g. **CORSAIR VOIDSCARRED STARSTORM DUELLIST Quick on the Trigger**), can it perform the Shoot action on the other side of a door that's ignored when determining visibility for the purposes of control range, even though the target isn't visible to it?
metadata.summary: An operative shooting while within control range cannot shoot targets behind doors ignored for visibility if the target is not visible.

document_chunks.text:
GORETHIRST - Firefight Ploy
The GORETHIRST firefight ploy allows counteracting with a Conceal-ordered friendly GOREMONGER operative by changing its order to Engage and restricting its actions to Charge, Shoot, or Fight.
## GORETHIRST - Firefight Ploy
Use this firefight ploy when you would counteract. You can do so with one friendly **GOREMONGER** operative that has a **Conceal** order, but you must change its order to **Engage** and it cannot perform any actions other than **Charge**, **Shoot** or **Fight** during that counteraction.

metadata.summary: The GORETHIRST firefight ploy allows counteracting with a Conceal-ordered friendly GOREMONGER operative by changing its order to Engage and restricting its actions to Charge, Shoot, or Fight.

document_chunks.text:
BRACE FOR COUNTERATTACK - Strategy Ploy*
Brace for Counterattack ploy reduces damage by 1 from Normal and Critical hits of 3 or more against friendly Breacher operatives within your territory or that haven't charged, fallen back, or repositioned this turning point.
## BRACE FOR COUNTERATTACK - Strategy Ploy*
Whenever an operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly **IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER** operative that's within your territory or that hasn't performed the **Charge**, **Fall Back** or **Reposition** action during this turning point, Normal and Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on that friendly operative.

metadata.summary: Brace for Counterattack ploy reduces damage by 1 from Normal and Critical hits of 3 or more against friendly Breacher operatives within your territory or that haven't charged, fallen back, or repositioned this turning point.

document_chunks.text:
NOOSPHERIC NETWORK - Faction Rule
Activating a BATTLECLADE SERVITOR allows TRANSFER POWER reducing its APL by 1 and enables NETWORK COUNTERACT by another SERVITOR to perform a free 1AP action without moving before opponent activation, with restrictions on APL and usage frequency.
## NOOSPHERIC NETWORK - Faction Rule
Whenever a friendly **BATTLECLADE SERVITOR** operative is activated, you can **TRANSFER POWER**. If you do, subtract 1 from its APL stat until the end of that activation.

After that activation, you can **NETWORK COUNTERACT** with one other friendly **BATTLECLADE SERVITOR** operative before your opponent activates. Whenever you **NETWORK COUNTERACT** with a friendly operative, first select its order. It can then perform a 1AP action for free, but cannot move. Once it's done so, your opponent then activates as normal.

An operative cannot **TRANSFER POWER** or **NETWORK COUNTERACT** if it has an APL stat of less than 2 (e.g. if the stat has been changed to less than 2 by a rule). **NETWORK COUNTERACT** is a counteraction, but the operative doesn't need to be expended with an Engage order to do it. That means if they're ready when they **NETWORK COUNTERACT**, they can still be activated as normal later in the turning point. An operative that does **NETWORK COUNTERACT** cannot do so again, or counteract, during the same turning point.

metadata.summary: Activating a BATTLECLADE SERVITOR allows TRANSFER POWER reducing its APL by 1 and enables NETWORK COUNTERACT by another SERVITOR to perform a free 1AP action without moving before opponent activation, with restrictions on APL and usage frequency.

document_chunks.text:
PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM - INCURSOR MARKSMAN
INCURSOR MARKSMAN can perform the Guard action anywhere, including with a Conceal order, but must change to Engage order when performing free Shoot or Fight during interruption.
## PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM - INCURSOR MARKSMAN
**Stats:**
- APL: 3
- Move: 7"
- Save: 3+
- Wounds: 12

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| ranged | Stalker marksman bolt carbine | 4 | 2+ | 3/4 | Lethal 5+, Piercing 1 |
| melee | Fists | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | - |

**Keywords:** PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INCURSOR, MARKSMAN

### INCURSOR MARKSMAN - Track Target
This operative can perform the **Guard** action regardless of the killzone (see close quarters rules, Kill Team Core Book). It can perform the **Guard** action while it has a **Conceal** order, but when you perform the free **Shoot** or **Fight** action during the interruption, you must change its order to **Engage**.

metadata.summary: INCURSOR MARKSMAN can perform the Guard action anywhere, including with a Conceal order, but must change to Engage order when performing free Shoot or Fight during interruption.

document_chunks.text:
SCOUT SQUAD - SCOUT SNIPER
Scout Sniper ignores Saturate rule when shot, gains enhanced cover saves, and can spend 1AP to negate obscured status for its shooting until next activation, but cannot do so within enemy control range.
## SCOUT SQUAD - SCOUT SNIPER
**Stats:**
- APL: 2
- Move: 6"
- Save: 4+
- Wounds: 10

**Weapons:**
| Type | Name | ATK | HIT | DMG | Weapon Rules |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Ranged | Bolt pistol | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | Range 8" |
| Ranged | Sniper rifle (mobile) | 4 | 3+ | 3/4 | |
| Ranged | Sniper rifle (stationary) | 4 | 2+ | 3/3 | **Devastating 3**, **Heavy (Dash only)**, **Silent** |
| Melee | Fists | 3 | 3+ | 3/4 | |

**Keywords:** SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, SNIPER

### SCOUT SNIPER - Camo Cloak
Whenever an operative is shooting this operative:
*   Ignore the **Saturate** weapon rule.
*   If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead. This isn't cumulative with improved cover saves from **Vantage** terrain.

### SCOUT SNIPER - OPTICS [1AP]
Until the start of this operative's next activation, whenever it's shooting, enemy operatives cannot be **obscured**.
This operative cannot perform this action while within **control range** of an enemy operative.

metadata.summary: Scout Sniper ignores Saturate rule when shot, gains enhanced cover saves, and can spend 1AP to negate obscured status for its shooting until next activation, but cannot do so within enemy control range.

hop_evaluations.reasoning: The retrieved context includes the ELIMINATOR SNIPER operative and the Silent weapon rule allowing shooting with Conceal order, but the ORDERS rule explicitly states that Conceal order prevents shooting and counteracting. The interaction between these rules is unclear without the full ORDERS rule definition. The ORDERS rule is present but truncated, so the full definition is available downstream. However, the question specifically asks if the Eliminator Sniper can shoot during counteract while having Conceal order, which involves the interaction of the Conceal order and counteract mechanics. The core mechanic 'COUNTERACT' rule definition is missing from the retrieved context, and it is essential to understand if counteracting with Conceal order is allowed or restricted. Therefore, the COUNTERACT rule definition is missing but available in Core Rules.
